boat.name: Zingela

owners.note: Lester McCarthy, Austen Sales Perkins, Joan Ryley and John Neville have owned 'Zingela': dates unknown.
owners.text: Lester McCarthy, Austen Sales Perkins, Joan Ryley and John Neville have owned 'Zingela': dates unknown.

boat.full_description:
Built by Robertsons of Woodbridge in 1965 as Sekyd for a Mr Dykes (Sekyd is Dykes backwards) In 1969 Zingela sailed from Woodbridge through the French canals to the Mediterranean, then to Durban, S Africa via the Red Sea. She raced on the South African coast from 1971 onwards. She returned to the UK in 1993. Essential work was undertaken by various people from 1999 to 2013.

She is a well equiped boat with both tiller pilot and Aries windvane auto steering. Reefing is slab on the main, and roller reefing on the  genoa, while a new spinnaker(in 2021) completes her sail wardrobe. Sheet control is through Lewmar winches. She caries full navigation equipment, instruments, marine radio, and Garmin551 chartplotter .

Yanmar 2GM20 inboard diesel engine with modern prop-seals.

Accomodation is typical of her class, with 4 berths. She is free of gas hazards, using a spirit cooker and charcoal stove.
boat.construction_details: Iroko on Oak Frames, ply decks
boat.short_description: Zingela is a much traveled Vertue, leaving the UK in 1969 and returning in 1993, having sailed to South Africa and back
